result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis Taylor Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Supervision fees.
$1,500.00 per month to be paid from Mr. Taylor's Veteran's Benefits. Mr. Taylor must execute all necessary paperwork to ensure the payments are taken from his benefits. Payments to be made directly by Mr. Taylor until the benefits issue is resolved.  Payments to be made to the  Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Signed and Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Thomas, in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $70.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning on 5/1/2018, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Defense requests a Status Conference to gather information. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned in Branch 18.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Back to court.

Received and Filed, Amended Stipulation and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction. 

Per Amended Stipulation and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction which states "After a review of the sentencing transcript the parties Stipulate that the Judgement of Conviction should read as follows":

Count 1:  Withheld sentence, 3 years of probation, Conditions to be concurrent to the sentences in 02CF005254 and 14CF004465. Specific  Conditions:
(1) $1,500.00 per month to be paid from Mr. Taylor's Veteran's Benefits. Mr. Taylor must execute all necessary paperwork to ensure the payments are taken from his benefits. Payments to be made directly by Mr. Taylor until the benefits issue is resolved. Payments to be made to the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund.  (2) One year of condition time to be used at the Court or Agent's discretion.  (3) Applicable costs and surcharges.  (4) DNA sample, and, (5) Supervision fees.

ERROR-The firearm/voting restrictions NOT entered/showing by closer on JOC.
TO CORRECT to add firearm/voting restrictions to JOC.
Also Stip and Order signed on 8/3/17 has typo.  It reads "conditions to be concurrent to the sentences in 02CF002169 and 14CF004465".  IT SHOULD READ " conditions to be concurrent to the sentences in 02CF005254 and 14CF004465".  Therefore the  JOC needs to be corrected to reflect the same.
And to add $35.00 warrant file, regarding warrant if file.

Corrected to reflect missing sentencing date.

Defendant Louis Taylor in court with Attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Louis Taylor in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  State in compliance with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Gloria F.
The Court imposed the following sentence:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant sentenced to serve ONE (1) year CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of THREE (3) years CONCURRENT TO 14CF4465 with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
*Starting October 10, 2015, the defendant has to pay child support in the amount of $1,500 a month to Gloria F.  Those payments are to come directly out of Defendant's VA Benefits and those payments are to go directly to Child Support Enforcement.
*Pay any court costs and surcharges AFTER child support is paid to victim, Gloria F.  If not paid by the end of probationary period, balance will convert to a civil judgment.
*The Court will consider early discharge if all arrears are paid.
*The Court ordered any bail on deposit in this case should be transferred to case 02CF5254 and go towards the child support payments.

Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Louis Taylor in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Louis Taylor in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was not ordered. Sentencing arguments completed. Additional statements by Gloria F. Case adjourned for sentencing, for parties to determine how restitution is to be paid. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Eric Hart requested an adjournment of the 9/3/15 hearing.  Matter adjourned to 9/9/15 at 1:30pm.  Attorney Hart will advised the State.

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant Louis Taylor not in court, in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
